target_markets.market_description: Entrepreneurs and business owners who think they understand their business but are actually solving the wrong problems
pain_points: jumping from business to business without realizing core issues
not understanding what business they're really in
target_markets.market_size_indicators: Mentions vast majority of entrepreneurs have this problem

problems_validated.problem: Entrepreneurs focus on product features instead of what actually drives business success
problems_validated.severity: Critical - prevents building generational wealth and scalable assets
problems_validated.current_solutions: Most entrepreneurs keep jumping between businesses
problems_validated.market_gap: Lack of understanding of the real business model behind successful companies

products_tools.name: Prestige Labs
products_tools.use_case: Health supplements with focus on premium ingredients
products_tools.pricing: premium pricing mentioned but not viable commercially

products_tools.name: AG1
products_tools.metrics: popular because of taste and feel-good factor

business_strategies.strategy: Look at the biggest players in your space and reverse engineer what actually makes them successful
business_strategies.implementation: Take your model to its natural extreme and analyze the leaders
business_strategies.expected_results: Understanding the real business you're in
business_strategies.case_study: Gym business leaders are acquisition machines, not fitness experts

business_strategies.strategy: Focus on the biggest limiting factor that gives the most return in your specific business vehicle
business_strategies.implementation: Identify whether your business is really about marketing/sales, branding/media, or delivery
business_strategies.expected_results: Unlock enterprise value and next level growth
business_strategies.case_study: Fitness business success comes from marketing/sales, not workout quality

problems_solutions.problem: Entrepreneurs focus on product quality when customers can't differentiate
problems_solutions.solution: Focus on what customers actually notice and value - branding, marketing, and perception
steps: Analyze what the biggest players in your space actually focus on
Identify if customers can actually perceive your differentiator
Shift focus to what drives actual business results

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Thinking you're building a product-based company when you're actually building a brand/media company
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Focusing resources on the wrong areas, limiting growth potential
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Study the biggest players in your space to understand what really drives their success
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Supplement company focusing on ingredients when success comes from branding and traffic

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Creating differentiators that only you can recognize
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Wasted effort on features customers don't value or notice
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Ensure your differentiator is something customers can actually perceive and value
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Making better gym workouts when customers choose gyms based on marketing and convenience

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Assuming fitness business is about fitness knowledge and results
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Missing the real business model of customer acquisition
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Recognize that fitness is about marketing and sales, not workout quality
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Biggest fitness companies treat workouts as an afterthought because people don't show up for other reasons

growth_tactics.tactic: Build acquisition machines rather than focusing on product perfection
steps: Treat product as secondary to acquisition
growth_tactics.results_expected: Scalable business growth and enterprise value

trends_signals.trend: Placebo effect is a real effect in supplement industry
trends_signals.opportunity: Focus on how products make people feel rather than just ingredients

actionable_quotes.quote: The vast majority of businesses that I talk to, the entrepreneurs think they're in one business but they're actually in another
actionable_quotes.context: Opening statement about common entrepreneurial mistake
actionable_quotes.actionability: Analyze what business you're really in vs what you think you're in

actionable_quotes.quote: Your differentiator isn't actually making you different - you're the only one who knows your differentiator which is not good
actionable_quotes.context: Explaining why product-focused differentiation often fails
actionable_quotes.actionability: Ensure customers can perceive and value your differentiators

actionable_quotes.quote: Most people take AG1 because they think it tastes good and because they feel good about it, not because what's inside of it
actionable_quotes.context: Explaining consumer behavior in supplement industry
actionable_quotes.actionability: Focus on customer experience and perception over technical specifications

key_statistics.statistic: Everyone's trying to lose weight three times a year
key_statistics.context: Explaining the recurring customer opportunity in fitness business

key_statistics.statistic: Started and sold 9 businesses over 13 years
